SEARCH

All Classes and Interfaces

Class
Description
AccountSimulator
Core simulation engine for credit card account behavior.
AccountSimulator.InterestMethod
Enumeration of supported interest calculation methods.
AccountSimulator.Summary
Container for simulation results including totals and time-series data.
AccountSimulatorTest
Test suite for AccountSimulator.
CreditCardCalculatorApp
Enhanced Swing GUI implementing: - UseCaseDescription full requirements - Settings page for APR, fees, grace period, due date, starting balance, reward policy, interest method - Dropdown for payment policy (Early, WallStreet, Light, Heavy) - Visualization selection (daily/weekly/monthly/yearly)
DefaultConfig
 
EarlyTransactor
Payment strategy that pays the full statement balance early.
FeeSchedule
Defines credit card fee schedule and APR constants.
FeeScheduleTest
Test suite for FeeSchedule.
HeavyRevolver
Payment strategy that makes only minimum payments with occasional late payments.
InterestCalculationStrategy
 
InterestResult
 
LightRevolver
Payment strategy that alternates between minimum payments and full payoff.
Main
Simple entry point for the CreditCardCalculatorBrionBlais application.
MainController
Main controller for the credit card calculator application.
MainControllerTest
Test suite for MainController.
PaymentInstruction
Represents a payment instruction specifying amount and date.
PaymentStrategiesTest
Test suite for all PaymentStrategy implementations.
PaymentStrategy
Strategy interface for determining payment amounts and dates.
RewardPolicy
Defines the reward rates for different transaction categories.
RewardPolicyTest
Test suite for RewardPolicy.
SimpleLineChartPanel
 
SimulationResult
 
SynchronyDailyBalanceStrategy
Simplified synchrony daily-balance interest calculation.
TestSuite
 
Transaction
Represents a single credit card transaction.
TransactionReader
Utility class for reading transactions from CSV files.
TransactionReaderTest
 
TransactionTest
Test suite for the Transaction class.
WallStreetTransactor
Payment strategy that pays the full balance on the last day of the grace period.
